SEARCH
Package com.example.segfaultsquadapplication.impl.db

Class DbUtils

java.lang.Object
com.example.segfaultsquadapplication.impl.db.DbUtils
public class DbUtils extends Object
Do not directly call query methods in here within fragments - use the related data manager instead.
The utility class for database connection and operations.
DbOpResultHandler is utilized to organize the "success" / "failure" callback. Here, whether to call "success" or "failure" is determined by both the operation result and additional logic (e.g. additional castings / success checks), if necessary.

    • wireMockAuth

      @Deprecated public static void wireMockAuth(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseAuth auth)

    • queryObjects

      public static <T extends IDbData> void queryObjects(String collection, Function<com.google.firebase.firestore.Query,com.google.firebase.firestore.Query> specifications, Class<T> tClass, @Nullable Collection<T> holder, DbOpResultHandler<com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot> handler)
      Query objects from a collection satisfying specifications (condition, order, limit etc.).
      If the query succeeds, all documents will be added to the holder if it is not null; If holder is null, success will be invoked without parsing documents.
      If the query fails, holder will not be modified.
      Parameters:
      collection - The collection to query from
      specifications - Transformations (filter, order, limit etc.) applied to the query
      tClass - The class type to convert into
      holder - Holder object
      handler - The result handler

    • getDocRef

      public static com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference getDocRef(String coll, String docPath)
      Gets a document reference. RECOMMENDED FOR TRANSACTION ONLY! For other usages, consider using other helper functions.
      Parameters:
      coll - The collection
      docPath - The document path
      Returns:
      A reference to the document.

    • getObjectByDocId

      public static <T extends IDbData> void getObjectByDocId(String collection, String docId, Class<T> tClass, AtomicReference<T> holder, DbOpResultHandler<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> handler)
      Retrieves an object implementing IDbData according to the document identifier.
      When handler's success function is called, the holder will contain the retrieved object.
      Parameters:
      collection - The collection name.
      docId - The document id.
      tClass - The class to initialize the object.
      holder - The holder that will contain the retrieved object on success.
      handler - Handler to encapsulate success/failure callback.

    • operateDocumentById

      public static <T> void operateDocumentById(String collection, String docId, Function<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference,com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<T>> operation, DbOpResultHandler<T> handler)
      Operates the document content by its collection and document ID.
      The operation could be get, update or delete.
      However, note that when getting a document, getObjectByDocId is usually easier to work with.
      Parameters:
      collection - The collection of the document.
      docId - The document ID.
      handler - The handler defining success / failure behavior.

    • operateTransaction

      public static <T> void operateTransaction(com.google.firebase.firestore.Transaction.Function<T> transaction, DbOpResultHandler<T> handler)
      Operates a transaction; the operations are either all successful or all aborted.
      Parameters:
      transaction - The transaction logic.
      handler - The handler defining success / failure behavior.

    • addObjectToCollection

      public static <T extends IDbData> void addObjectToCollection(String collection, T data, DbOpResultHandler<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference> handler)
      Adds the data to the collection. On success, the object's id is updated to the allocated file name.
      Parameters:
      collection - The collection name.
      data - The data to add.
      handler - Handler to encapsulate success/failure callback.
